Authorization.
sections.text: §277-2 Authorization.The department of transportation shall establish, maintain, operate, manage and control energy corridors throughout the State for the purpose of maximizing the utilization of lands available for use in connection with transporting by pipeline or other means, sources of energy including but not limited to oil, its derivatives and natural gas; provided that the utilization of such energy corridors shall be permissive and not mandatory. [L 1970, c 33, §2]

sections.heading: Acquisition of lands.
sections.text: §277-3 Acquisition of lands.The director of transportation in the name of the State and subject to the approval of the governor may for the purposes of this chapter acquire, by purchase or eminent domain, private property in fee simple, or any lesser interest therein, including leases, all property necessary for the establishment, maintenance, operation, management and control of energy corridors. [L 1970, c 33, §3]

sections.heading: Disposition.
sections.text: §277-4 Disposition.The director of transportation may dispose of any interests in the lands acquired for the purposes of this chapter by lease or license or by the grant of easements to any person who is engaged in the business of furnishing or delivering sources of energy, in bulk. [L 1970, c 33, §4]
